website_summaries.verdict: The majority of the purchasers were satisfied and contented with the Reebok Instalite Lux' design and durability. Aside from its excellent structure, they admired its performance on long, and short-distance walks and runs. Although some of the buyers had an issue with its length and width, others still lauded the shoe because of its lightweight construction. Overall, the Reebok Instalite Lux was accepted by many because of its design, affordable price, and fantastic performance.
pros: One of the users commented that the Reebok Instalite Lux feels lightweight
The running shoe was durable, according to a purchaser
A reviewer said that the shoe has an excellent design
According to some comments, the Instalite Lux also works well on long walks, and gym workouts
Most buyers lauded the shoe’s excellent quality
cons: The Reebok Instalite Lux runs small
According to a user, the width of the shoe was too wide
Based on a review, the shoe was not supportive

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit & Width
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to add a review to discuss the ‘fit’ as most existing reviews did not have much detail. Width is usually my biggest concern when buying sneakers. Also the reason I prefer Reebok over Nike as many Nike’s are too narrow. That being said this show feels great! I have somewhat flat/wide feet and it feels great. No bump on the inside arch and overall look great! Reebok is ☝🏻
customer_reviews.author: Southpaw14

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves these.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these so we ordered another pair. He says they fit true to size. They are very comfortable for all all day. He works at Walmart as Happy To Help which means he is running all over Walmart, unlocking all the locked items for people for his entire shift.
customer_reviews.author: laurieca1

customer_reviews.title: Sole not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is well made, light and fits me great. However, after 3 months of walking 2-4 miles per day, 3-4 times per week on concrete and blacktop sidewalks, the soles are already wearing through into the foam layer underneath. This shoe is probably better suited for mall walking or running the track at your fitness center, but not great for outdoor terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Korey, Fargo ND

customer_reviews.title: Good value lightweight shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought for running. Insole could be more padded. Not as comfortable as Reebok Astroride, my last shoes. I just ran 3miles in them and they are ok. I may take the insoles from Astroride and swap them in these.
customer_reviews.author: Skull-78

customer_reviews.title: Soft and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son. Just a bit larger than expected, he found them lightweight and comfortable from the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria F

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, a tad wide
customer_reviews.text: Length is good, but shoe feels wide. Maybe a half size smaller? Cool and light. Kind of ugly, but functional. A good bargain at 30ish dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Allison

customer_reviews.title: My favorites
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shoes. Light, easy to clean and very comfortable. They are great. I wear them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tolson

customer_reviews.title: “airy”
customer_reviews.text: Surprised I got it for the price. Great shoes. Comfortable and “airy”
customer_reviews.author: Swin Banor

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not comfortable at all I bought it for gym and I don’t like when I’m working out but it is good for work and places where you don’t do a lot of physical work on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: mir

customer_reviews.title: Holding up so far
customer_reviews.text: Ok so far. Worn a few times and it's still holding up.
customer_reviews.author: L K

customer_reviews.title: Great price for good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm not putting tons of miles on these, but do run a little and go to the gym every day. Money well spent, I say.
customer_reviews.author: sadelack

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, but flawed!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoes, but flaws include paper thin insoles that provide no arch support. The toe box is quite narrow too. I had to return mine.
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Heal started to tear after a handful of uses.
customer_reviews.text: Was satisfied with the purchase initially, but after around 15-20 uses the inside of the heal started to rip causing blisters on my heal.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Loveland

customer_reviews.title: Good for running
customer_reviews.text: My feet is little bit broad, so it’s not fitting me to the comfort that I need. In picture, shoe color looked as dark gray but I got kinda silver gray. Otherwise it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mohan Rangaraj

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great fit my husband said so comfortable will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have been working great and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in a week. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son. It ripped in multiple places within a week. Do not waste your money. Did not expect this from Reebok
customer_reviews.author: VSC

customer_reviews.title: their good for walking the track
customer_reviews.text: I love these sneaker the fit is great they are comfortable. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Style and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I didn't dislike anything about these they fit good and look nice.
customer_reviews.author: LM.

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's Instalite Lux Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Reebok was founded for one of the best reasons possible: athletes wanted to run faster. So in the 1890s, joseph william Foster made some of the first known running shoes with spikes in them. By 1895, he was in business making shoes by hand for top runners; and before long his fledgling company, j.W. Foster and sons, developed an international clientele of distinguished athletes.
